title: Glen Canyon National Recreation Area: Archive
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     News     News Releases     Archive                News Release Archive           Subscribe  | What is RSS     June 15, 2015  New Waste Disposal Requirements for Coyote Gulch Visitors  Due to increased visitation and the lack of toilets at Coyote Gulch, hikers in the popular Coyote Gulch area of the Escalante backcountry will now be required to pack out their own solid waste using a portable waste containment bag.   May 22, 2015  Hours of Operation for Glen Canyon National Recreation Area Spring 2015  Spring 2015 operation hours.   May 18, 2015  Glen Canyon National Recreation Area Will Increase Entrance Camping and Boat Use Fees Beginning June 1 2015  Starting on June 1, Glen Canyon National Recreation Area will increase fees for visitors in order to fund important maintenance and improvement projects within the park.   April 27, 2015  All Lanes Reopened on Glen Canyon Bridge April 2015  All lanes have reopened on the Glen Canyon Bridge.  The Wahweap main ramp pump-out and fish cleaning stations have also reopened.   April 23, 2015  Tourism to Glen Canyon National Recreation Area and Rainbow Bridge National Monument Creates Over $175 Million in Economic Benefits  new National Park Service (NPS) report shows that over 2.4 million people visited Glen Canyon National Recreation Area and Rainbow Bridge National Monument in 2014.   April 17, 2015  Updates on Glen Canyon Bridge Lane Closure April 2015  The closure of one lane of the Glen Canyon Bridge for waste water pipeline maintenance will occur on weeknights between the hours of 6:00 p.m. and 6:00 a.m. Arizona Mountain Standard Time starting the evening of Monday April 20 through the morning of Saturday May 2, 2015.   April 10, 2015  Glen Canyon Bridge Lane Closure April 2015  One lane of the Glen Canyon Bridge will be closed for waste water pipeline maintenance on weekdays from April 13 – 24, 2015 between 6:00 a.m. and 4:00 p.m. Mountain Standard Time.   April 03, 2015  Chains Road is Open April 3 2015  As of April 3, 2015, the Chains road, a popular point of access to Lake Powell, has been opened. National Park Service staff made temporary repairs to facilitate public access until more permanent upgrades to the road takes place.   March 27, 2015  Public Comment Period Open for Review of Wahweap Roads Plan  Glen Canyon National Recreation Area is seeking public comment on a newly released environmental assessment (EA) for the proposed rehabilitation of Lakeshore Drive and Wahweap Boulevard within Glen Canyon National Recreation Area.   March 26, 2015  Volunteer Open House at Lees Ferry on April 4 2015  The public is invited to Lonely Dell Ranch at Lees Ferry for a volunteer open house event from 10:00 a.m.until 2:00 p.m. (Arizona MST) on Saturday, April 4, 2015.   March 20, 2015  Rainbow Bridge National Monument to Reopen March 2015  Rainbow Bridge National Monument will reopen to the public on Saturday, March 21, 2015.   March 05, 2015  Rainbow Bridge National Monument Closed Until Further Notice March 2015  Effective immediately, the trail from Lake Powell to Rainbow Bridge National Monument is closed for repairs. Recent flood activity has damaged a segment of the trail making it unsafe to hike from the lake. Plans to repair the trail are currently underway.   February 20, 2015  Half of Antelope Point Launch Ramp Closed Feb 2015  The west half of the Antelope Point launch ramp closes on February 19, 2015 to all launching due to low lake levels.   January 29, 2015  Rainbow Bridge National Monument Reopens Jan 30 2015  Construction is complete on the trail from the docks to the Rainbow Bridge viewing area.   January 08, 2015  Open House on Glen Canyon Proposed Fee Increase  Glen Canyon National Recreation Area will host an open house for the public to learn more about proposed changes to fees collected in the park.   December 23, 2014  Rainbow Bridge National Monument Closed for Trail Work Jan 2015 UPDATE  Rainbow Bridge National Monument will be closed to the public from January 5, through February 15, 2015.   December 19, 2014  Glen Canyon National Recreation Area Proposes Fee Increase  Glen Canyon National Recreation Area is proposing an increase to entrance, camping, and boat use fees in accordance with direction from the National Park Service authorizing all park units to conduct stakeholder outreach through civic engagement to gauge support for possible fee changes.   December 12, 2014  Glen Canyon Recruits Volunteers for 2015 Christmas Bird Count  Glen Canyon National Recreation Area is currently recruiting volunteers for the Audubon Christmas Bird Count on January 5, 2015.   November 14, 2014  Quagga Mussel Update Nov 2014  Glen Canyon National Recreation Area staff continue to monitor park waters to determine the distribution of quagga mussels.   November 14, 2014  Two Wahweap Area Services to Close for the 2014-15 Winter Season  The comfort stations at Wahweap Beach and the Wahweap picnic grounds will close for the winter in coming weeks. The Wahweap Beach comfort station will be winterized and closed on November 17, 2014. The picnic area comfort station will close on December 1, 2014.   November 11, 2014  Rainbow Bridge National Monument to Close for Trail Repair Jan 2015  Rainbow Bridge National Monument will be closed for the month of January to complete repairs to the trail from Lake Powell.   November 06, 2014  Winter 2014-15 Hours for Wahweap Main Ramp Pump-out  Winter hours will begin on Monday, November 10, 2014 for the boat pump-out station at Wahweap main ramp. Hours of operation for the pump-out will be 9:00 a.m. to 2:00 p.m. daily. Fresh water will not be available during winter operating hours.   October 24, 2014  Glen Canyon National Recreation Area Announces Winter Hours 2014-15  National Park Service (NPS) and concessioner-operated facilities will reduce hours of operation at some facilities, while closing others. Please contact concession services directly for further information.   September 29, 2014  Chains Road Closed for Repairs Sept 2014  Heavy rains and flood damage on Saturday, September 27 led to the closure of the Chains road in the afternoon. It is not known at this time how long the work may take to complete.   September 12, 2014  Stateline Pump-out to Close for Season 2014  The boat pump-out at Stateline launch ramp will be closed for the season beginning on September 15, 2014.   August 29, 2014  Fire Restrictions Lifted in Glen Canyon Aug 2014  Due to recent monsoon precipitation, extended fire restrictions will be lifted on August 29, 2014 in Glen Canyon National Recreation Area and Rainbow Bridge National Monument.   August 22, 2014  National Park Service Celebrates 98th Birthday  Glen Canyon National Recreation Area will celebrate the 98th birthday of the National Park Service by waiving its normal entrance fee of $15 and providing a free ranger-led hike to the Hanging Gardens at 6:00 p.m. on Monday, August 25.   August 19, 2014  Missing Swimmer Recovered Near Bullfrog Marina  National Park Service Dispatch received a 911 call reporting a missing swimmer near Bullfrog Marina at approximately 2:45 pm MST on Thursday, August 14, 2014.   July 25, 2014  Boat Propeller Injures Twelve-Year Old Girl  National Park Service Dispatch received a call on July 23, 2014 reporting that a twelve-year old female from Israel was struck by a boat propeller and sustained a severe lower leg injury.   July 24, 2014  The Chains Road Opens July 25 2014  National Park Service (NPS) maintenance staff completed temporary repairs to the Chains road which opened late in the afternoon on Thursday July 24, 2014. Vehicles can now access the Chains area and the Hanging Garden trail head from sunrise to sunset.   July 18, 2014  Tourism to Glen Canyon National Recreation Area and Rainbow Bridge National Monument creates over 118 million in Economic Benefit  Report shows visitor spending supports 1473 jobs in local economy   June 27, 2014  Navajo Bridge Interpretive Center Will Close on June 29th  Navajo Bridge Interpretive Center Will Close on June 29th   June 27, 2014  Fire Restrictions At Glen Canyon National Recreation Area and Rainbow Bridge National Monument 2014  Due to recent fire activity, dry conditions, and high fire danger in southwest Utah and northwest Arizona, Interagency Fire Managers are expanding current fire restrictions.   June 24, 2014  Significant Emergency Response Incidents June 2014  Multiple serious incidents June 17-24, 2014   June 05, 2014  Antelope Point Public Launch Ramp Opens June 6 2014  The Antelope Point public launch ramp will open on Friday, June 6th, 2014. Boaters should still be aware that while the ramp is open, launching at these water levels is not safe for all sizes of boats and launching is at your own risk.   June 04, 2014  Lakeshore Drive Road Rehabilitation EA Open House  Park staff will provide information and answer questions about the rehabilitation of Lakeshore Drive at an open house scheduled at park headquarters in Page, AZ on Tuesday, June 10 from 5:00 p.m. to 7:00 p.m.   June 03, 2014  Glen Canyon National Recreation Area Receives 2014 America’s Best Idea Grant from the National Park Foundation  Glen Canyon National Recreation Area is one of 39 national park units selected to receive a 2014 America's Best Idea grant from the National Park Foundation, the official charity of America's national parks.   May 27, 2014  Lakeshore Drive Road Rehabilitation EA  The National Park Service (NPS) invites the public to provide comments related to the proposed rehabilitation, restoration and resurfacing of approximately five miles of Lakeshore Drive, two miles of Wahweap Boulevard, and 0.3 miles of Wahweap Marina Drive in Glen Canyon National Recreation Area.   May 23, 2014  Quagga Mussel Containment Strategy  The National Park Service (NPS) has developed a response strategy in accordance with the NPS Quagga/Zebra Mussel Infestation Prevention and Response Planning Guide (2007) to help reduce the spread of quagga mussels from Lake Powell to other lakes and rivers.   May 06, 2014  Castle Rock Cut and Bullfrog Ramp Completed  Glen Canyon National Recreation Area staff in partnership with ARAMARK, completed the Castle Rock Cut excavation which lowered the bottom elevation to 3580'.   March 03, 2014  Tourism to Glen Canyon National Recreation Area and Rainbow Bridge National Monument creates Economic Benefits  A new National Park Service (NPS) report shows that 2,136,542 visitors to Glen Canyon National Recreation Area and Rainbow Bridge National Monument in 2012 spent $190 million in communities near the parks.  That spending supported 1488 jobs in the local area.   February 25, 2014  Additional Adult Quagga Mussels Found in Lake Powell  The National Park Service and Utah Division of Wildlife Resources (UDWR) have recently detected additional adult quagga mussels in Lake Powell.   January 24, 2014  Open Houses Scheduled for Upcoming Glen Canyon National Recreation Planning Efforts  A proposed Off-road Vehicle Management Plan for Glen Canyon National Recreation Area and the future of Lake Powell invasive mussel prevention are two planning efforts that will be showcased at five open houses in February.  National Park Service staff will be on hand to provide information and gather public comments on these and other current planning topics.   January 21, 2014  Castle Rock Cut Deepened 2014  Work will begin Tuesday, January 21, 2014 to deepen the Castle Rock Cut. The excavation project will increase the number of usable days of the cut during lower lake levels.   January 06, 2014  Public Review Period for Glen Canyon Off-road Vehicle Management Plan  The Off-road Vehicle Management Plan/Draft Environmental Impact Statement (Plan/DEIS) for Glen Canyon National Recreation Area (Glen Canyon) is available for public review and comment.   January 06, 2014  public review period begin for glen canyon off-road vehicle management plan  The Off-road Vehicle Management Plan/Draft Environmental Impact Statement (Plan/DEIS) for Glen Canyon National Recreation Area (Glen Canyon) is available for public review and comment.   November 07, 2013  Winter Hours Begin at Wahweap Main Ramp Pump-out  Winter hours will begin immediately for the main ramp pump-out station at Wahweap due to forecasts of below freezing temperatures.   October 11, 2013  National Park Service Enters Agreement with State of Utah to Re-open Eight National Parks  The National Park Service today announced that it has entered into an agreement with the State of Utah that will allow eight national parks in the state to re-open and temporarily operate during the government shutdown.   September 26, 2013  Rainbow Bridge National Monument Opens September 27 2013  Rainbow Bridge National Monument will reopen to the public on Friday, September 27, 2013.   September 19, 2013  Antelope Point Launch Ramp Will Remain Open  Antelope Point launch ramp will remain open for the time being due to increased lake levels caused by the recent flood events.   September 13, 2013  Rainbow Bridge National Monument Closed Sept 12 2013  Rainbow Bridge National Monument is closed indefinitely due to a trail washout after heavy rains fell in the area over the last several days.   September 11, 2013  Antelope Point Launch Ramp Closes  Antelope Point launch ramp will close on September 23, 2013 to all launches with boat trailers due to low lake levels.   August 30, 2013  Drainage Improvements at Bullfrog  The National Park Service (NPS) invites the public to provide comments related to the proposed improvement of water drainage in the Bullfrog developed area of Glen Canyon National Recreation Area.   August 28, 2013  RV Fire at Lone Rock Beach August 2013  Just after 2:00 PM on Friday August 23rd, firefighters from the National Park Service (NPS), Big Water Fire Department and Greenhaven Fire Department battled a large recreational vehicle (RV) fire on Lone Rock Beach.   August 23, 2013  Impacts of Lower Water Levels  The public is asked to use extreme caution when using the public launch ramps at Lake Powell.  The decrease in water levels has reduced the depth of water in these areas, creating shallow water on the ramps with steep drop-offs.   July 26, 2013  Wahweap Fish Cleaning Station Closed for Repair July 26 2013  The Wahweap Fish Cleaning Station is closed until further notice due to electrical failure.   July 05, 2013  Helicopter-assisted Data Collection Between Glen Canyon Dam and Lees Ferry  A single helicopter will be flying at about 600 feet above the ground surface in the fifteen miles between Glen Canyon Dam and Lees Ferry for 1 day during the week of July 7, 2013.   July 01, 2013  Stateline Pump-Out Open  The stateline pump-out station is open as of June 26, 2013.   July 01, 2013  5-Year Old Killed in Boating Accident  On June 28, 2013 at approximately 6:30 pm a 5-year old boy was killed in a boating accident uplake from Bullfrog near buoy 110 by Tapestry Wall.   June 28, 2013  Fire in Restrooms at Navajo Bridge Interpretive Center  At approximately 5:30 this morning, National Park Service dispatch received a report of smoke at the Navajo Bridge Interpretive Center near Marble Canyon.  Page Fire Department responded to the incident.   June 27, 2013  2013 ACTIVE TRAILS GRANT FROM THE NATIONAL PARK FOUNDATION  Glen Canyon National Recreation Area and Rainbow Bridge National Monument are one of 22 national park units across the country selected to receive a 2013 Active Trails grant from the National Park Foundation, the official charity of America’s national parks.   June 27, 2013  Lake Powell Boating Accident June 21 2013  At approximately 9:15 am Utah Time on Thursday June 20, 2013, National Park Service Dispatch, located at Wahweep Marina on Lake Powell received a report by marine band radio about a boat accident at buoy 43 near Dangling Rope Marina.   A north bound motor boat headed to Rainbow Bridge carrying 13 passengers, 7 adults and 6 children had collided with a south bound house boat and overturned.   June 26, 2013  Missing Man Found June 26 2013  The body of sixty-one year old Joe Coffield from Snellville, Georgia was found today at approximately 11:00 am.   June 25, 2013  Missing Man June 24 2013  National Park Service dispatch received a report of a potential drowning Monday, June 24, at approximately 1:00 pm.   June 20, 2013  Fire Restrictions 2013  Due to recent dry conditions and high fire danger in southwest Utah and northwest Arizona, fire restrictions are now in effect in Glen Canyon National Recreation Area and Rainbow Bridge National Monument.   June 14, 2013  Glen Canyon National Recreation Area and Rainbow Bridge National Monument Receive 2013 Active Trails Grant from the National Park Foundation  Glen Canyon National Recreation Area and Rainbow Bridge National Monument are one of 22 national park units across the country selected to receive a 2013 Active Trails grant from the National Park Foundation, the official charity of America’s national parks.   June 14, 2013  Successful Quagga Mussel Blitz  The National Park Service (NPS), in collaboration with other federal, state, and local  agencies as well as partners, conducted an intensive four-day dive operation from June 10-June 14 to assess the extent of quagga mussels in lower Lake Powell and to remove all existing mussels. A total of 36 divers and 73 support staff destroyed 235 mussels.   May 31, 2013  Quagga Mussel Blitz  Twenty-five to thirty divers will be in the water the week of June 10 to assess the extent of quagga mussels in Lake Powell and to remove all existing mussels.   May 23, 2013  Stateline Pump-out Station Closed for Repair  The pump-out station at Stateline will be closed indefinitely for repair and maintenance.   May 10, 2013  May Mussel Update  The National Park Service (NPS) has identified over 150 adult quagga mussels attached to moored vessels and dock structures at the Wahweap and Antelope Point Marinas in Lake Powell over the last month.   April 03, 2013  Wahweap Fish Cleaning Station Closed for Repair  The Wahweap Fish Cleaning Station experienced a waterline break in the early morning of April 2, 2013 and will be closed until further notice.   March 29, 2013  Teens Rescued in Joint Operation  Two teens rescued from a 200ft deep slot canyon on the morning od March 20, 2013.   March 28, 2013  New Personal Watercraft Regulation in Effect January 1 2013  A new Personal Watercraft (PWC) regulation went into effect on January 1, 2013 which requires PWC operating on Lake Powell to meet 2006 emission standards established by the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA).   March 28, 2013  2013 Spring Operational Hours for Glen Canyon National Recreation Area  Glen Canyon National Recreation Area and its concessioners are expanding operational hours and opening facilities parkwide for the spring season.   March 27, 2013  National Park Service Issues Mussel Monitoring Update for Lake Powell March 27 2013  The National Park Service (NPS) has identified 14 adult quagga mussels attached to moored vessels and dock structures at the Wahweap Marina in Lake Powell over the last week.  None of the adult mussels were close enough together to mate for successful reproduction.  All of the mussels were physically removed from the lake.   March 08, 2013  Wahweap Ramp Pump-out Closed for Repair  The main ramp pump-out station at Wahweap will be closed for approximately one week beginning Monday, March 25, 2013 to provide major maintenance on the floats.   February 26, 2013  Economic Benefits of Glen Canyon and Rainbow Bridge  A new National Park Service (NPS) report for 2011 shows that the 2.3 million visitors to Glen Canyon National Recreation Area and Rainbow Bridge National Monument spent $238 million in nearby communities.   February 26, 2013  Lees Ferry 2013 Road Construction  The Lees Ferry entry road will be under construction for approximately six months beginning Monday, March 11, 2013.   February 11, 2013  Bullfrog Pump-out Closed for Repair  The Bullfrog pump-out station will be closed for approximately two weeks beginning Monday, February 11, 2013 to provide major maintenance on the floats   February 07, 2013  Castle Rock Cut Deepened  Work will begin Monday, February 25, 2013 to deepen the Castle Rock Cut.   January 02, 2013  Applications are now being accepted for Glen Canyon National Recreation Areas 2013 Artist-in-Park Program  Glen Canyon National Recreation Area is now accepting artist applications for three volunteer positions for its 2013 season.   December 28, 2012  Glen Canyon Recruits Volunteers for Christmas Bird Count  Superintendent Todd Brindle invites you to participate in the 113th annual Audubon Christmas Bird Count on Thursday, January 3, 2013, in Glen Canyon National Recreation Area.   November 30, 2012  Glen Canyon National Recreation Area Announces Castle Rock Cut Advisory, Dangling Rope Marina Closure, and Winter Hours  The depth of Castle Rock Cut in Lake Powell is approximately six feet.  Boaters should be cautious in this area and use the cut at their own risk.   November 23, 2012  New PWC Regulation in Effect January 2013  A new Personal Watercraft (PWC) regulation will go into effect on January 1, 2013 which requires PWC operating on Lake Powell to meet 2006emission standards established by the Environmental Protection Agency(EPA).   November 01, 2012  National Park Service Issues Mussel Monitoring Update for Lake Powell  Recent monitoring samples from Lake Powell have revealed evidence of microscopic Quagga mussel larvae and the National Park Service (NPS) has accelerated laboratory and field efforts to identify the source, reported Glen Canyon National Recreation Area Superintendent Todd Brindle.   October 26, 2012  Boat Fire at Wahweap Marina  Firefighters battling a houseboat fire early Thursday morning, October 25, at the Wahweap Marina in Glen Canyon National Recreation Area saved multiple vessels with their quick response.   October 11, 2012  Body of Missing Second Swimmer Recovered Oct 10  The body of 58 year-old drowning victim John Borden was recovered from Lake Powell on October 10 by the Glen Canyon National Recreation Area Underwater Recovery Unit.   October 09, 2012  Traffic Restrictions During Triathlon Oct 13  Lakeshore Drive will be temporarily converted into a one-way thoroughfare on Saturday, October 13, 2012 from 7:00 am to approximately 1:00 pm to accommodate the 6th annual Powell 3 Triathlon.   October 04, 2012  National Fossil Day Celebrated Early on October 6  Visitors are invited to participate in many fun activities at the Carl Hayden Visitor Center on Saturday, October 6 from 10:00 am to 2:00 pm to celebrate National Fossil Day.   October 04, 2012  Body of Missing Swimmer Recovered Oct 3  The body of 40 year-old drowning victim Pejman Pourhassan was recovered from Lake Powell on October 3 by the Glen Canyon National Recreation Area Underwater Recovery Unit.   September 26, 2012  LONE ROCK BEACH SHOWERS CLOSED  The showers at Lone Rock Beach will be closed for planned maintenance work to improve the facilities beginning October 1, 2012 and will reopen in May.  All restroom facilities will remain open and available for public use.   September 26, 2012  TWO PEOPLE MISSING IN SEPARATE INCIDENCES  National Park Service Rangers are searching for two missing persons in two separate incidences that occurred over the last several days.   August 15, 2012  Glen Canyon National Recreation Area Helps Restore Natural Balance and Cultural Connections Along the San Juan River  The National Park Service has successfully launched Restoring Natural and Cultural Balance along the San Juan River, a project that engages underserved Native American youth in natural and cultural stewardship activities along the San Juan River located within Glen Canyon National Recreation Area and the Navajo Indian Reservation.   July 07, 2012  Fatalities in the San Juan River Arm  A tragic accident yesterday which involved two personal watercraft (PWC) resulted in the death of two adults in the San Juan arm of Lake Powell.   June 28, 2012  2012 Mussel Prevention in Full Swing  Four vessels with adult mussels attached have been intercepted and prevented from launching on Lake Powell so far this season.   June 21, 2012  Body of Missing Swimmer Recovered  The body of 26 year-old drowning victim Colby Roman was recovered from Lake Powell on June 20 by the Glen Canyon National Recreation Area Underwater Recovery Unit.   June 15, 2012  Fire Restrictions At Glen Canyon National Recreation Area and Rainbow Bridge National Monument  As a result of continued dry weather, fire restrictions are now in effect in Glen Canyon National Recreation Area and Rainbow Bridge National Monument.   June 01, 2012  2012 Updated Regulations Available for Glen Canyon and Rainbow Bridge  Superintendent Todd Brindle announced today the availability of the 2012 Superintendent’s Compendium for Glen Canyon National Recreation Area and Rainbow Bridge National Monument.   May 17, 2012  US Agencies Join Forces with First Lady Michelle Obama and Dr. Biden to Honor and Support Military Families  several U.S. government agencies including the National Park Service announced an annual pass to active duty service members and their dependents, granting free access to more than 2,000 national parks, wildlife refuges, national forests, and other public lands around the nation in the coming years.   May 11, 2012  New Night Closure Gate at Antelope Point Public Launch Ramp  Operation of a new night closure gate at the Antelope Point Marina Public Launch Ramp will begin on May 17, 2012.   May 08, 2012  Glen Canyon National Recreation Area The Premier Eclipse Viewing Location  Join Glen Canyon National Recreation Area staff on May 20 to experience a rare annular eclipse of the sun.   May 04, 2012  New Exhibit at the Carl Hayden Visitor Center  A new exhibit, The Colorado: River of Possibilities, opens May 11, 2012 at the Carl Hayden Visitor Center.   April 30, 2012  Building and Utilities Crew to Perform Maintenance on Wells in Wahweap  Maintenance on wells in Wahweap will begin April 30 and is projected to last until May 5   April 20, 2012  Halls Crossing Pump-out Open  The boat pump-out station at Hall’s Crossing Marina is open and has a new location.   April 17, 2012  Summer Operational Hours for Glen Canyon National Recreation Area 2012  Glen Canyon National Recreation Area and its concessioners are expanding operational hours and opening facilities parkwide for the summer season.   April 11, 2012  National Park Week April 21-29 2012  ‘Picture Yourself in a National Park’ Come enjoy your parks! Entrance into the parks and all National Park Service programs are FREE during National Park Week April 21-29.   April 06, 2012  Boat With Mussels Intercepted  A vessel with adult mussels attached was intercepted Wednesday at the Bullfrog Marina inspection station at Glen Canyon National Recreation Area. The vessel was thoroughly decontaminated by National Park Service staff and will be held in quarantine until the boat no longer poses a threat to Lake Powell or any other water body.   March 16, 2012  Fatality at Lees Ferry  A 34 year-old male from Laramie, Wyoming was found dead at Lees Ferry today.   March 09, 2012  Spring 2012 Operational Hours for Glen Canyon National Recreation Area  Glen Canyon National Recreation Area and its concessioners are expanding operational hours and opening facilities parkwide for the spring season.   March 01, 2012  Date Correction for Glen Canyon Lecture Series Event in March  In a press release issued earlier this month the date for March's Glen Canyon Lecture Series was incorrect.   February 28, 2012  Glen Canyon National Recreation Area and Rainbow Bridge National Monument Support Visitors Money and Jobs for Local Economy  A new National Park Service (NPS) report shows that 2.2 million visitors in 2010 spent over $186 million in Glen Canyon National Recreation Area, Rainbow Bridge National Monument and in nearby communities. That spending supported 2345 jobs in the local area.   February 23, 2012  Halls Crossing Boat Pump-out to Remain Closed Indefinitely  The boat pump-out at Hall's Crossing Marina will remain closed indefinitely for repair.   February 16, 2012  Celebrate Arizona Archeology and Heritage Awareness Month in March with Glen Canyon National Recreation Area  Glen Canyon will host a series of events in March to honor Arizona Archeology and Heritage Awareness Month.   February 13, 2012  Artists Announced for Glen Canyon National Recreation Areas 2012 Artist-in-Park Program  Artists selected for this year’s Artist-in-Park program represent a wide range of visual techniques, yet share common inspiration in the landscape.   February 02, 2012  Glen Canyon National Recreation Area Celebrates the Arizona Centennial with a Fee-Free Day on February 14  Visitors to Glen Canyon National Recreation Area on February 14, 2012 will be treated to a fee-free day.   January 23, 2012  Halls Crossing Boat Pumpout to Close for Maintenance  The boat pump-out at Hall's Crossing Marina will close January 29, 2012 and will reopen to the public March 2nd, 2012.   January 18, 2012  Denise Shultz Selected As Chief of Interpretation  Denise Shultz has been selected as the Chief of Interpretation, Education and Partnerships for Glen Canyon National Recreation Area and Rainbow Bridge National Monument.   December 16, 2011  Glen Canyon National Recreation Area to Participate in Annual Christmas Bird Count  Glen Canyon National Recreation Area (Glen Canyon) will once again participate in the annual Christmas Bird Count on January 3, 2012.   December 01, 2011  New Speed Limit for Lakeshore Drive  Superintendent Todd Brindle announced today that beginning January 3, 2012, the speed limit on Lakeshore Drive will change from 55 mph to 45 mph.   November 22, 2011  Glen Canyon Announces Winning Painting from Artist-in-Park Robert Dalegowski  Above Lees Ferry, a Plein Air watercolor painting rendered by Flagstaff artist Robert Dalegowski, has been voted the People’s Choice by park visitors.   November 16, 2011  Applications are now being accepted for Glen Canyon National Recreation Areas 2012 Artist-in-Park Program  Glen Canyon National Recreation Area is now accepting artist applications for its 2012 season.   November 03, 2011  Glen Canyon Waives Entrance Fees in Observance of Veterans Day 2011  Glen Canyon National Recreation Area will not charge entrance fees during Veterans Day weekend, Friday, November 11 through Sunday November 13, 2011.   October 21, 2011  Glen Canyon National Recreation Area Announces Winter Hours  Beginning on November 1, National Park Service (NPS) and concessioner-operated facilities will reduce hours of operation at some facilities, while closing others.   October 19, 2011  Road Construction at Lakeshore Drive and Wahweap Boulevard  On Tuesday, October 25, road construction will take place at the intersection of Lakeshore Drive and Wahweap Boulevard near Wahweap Marina.   October 07, 2011  Rangers Respond to Boat Fire at Glen Canyon National Recreation Area  At approximately 1:47 a.m. on October 7, National Park Service (NPS) dispatch at Glen Canyon National Recreation Area (NRA) received a call of a boat fire on "O" dock at the Wahweap marina.   October 06, 2011  Earth Science Week Events at Glen Canyon NRA Oct 8-14  In addition to National Fosssil Day Activities on October 8, Glen Canyon National Recreation Area will celebrate Earth Science Week with special guest ranger talks Oct. 13 and 14.   October 04, 2011  Hours of Operation Changing at Glen Canyon National Recreation Area  As the season begins to wind down, some hours of operation for park, concession and partner facilities have begun to change.   September 28, 2011  National Fossil Day Events at Glen Canyon National Recreation Area  The National Park Service and the American Geological Institute are once again partnering nationally to host the second annual National Fossil Day on October 13, 2011 as part of Earth Science Week. Locally, Glen Canyon National Recreation Area will celebrate National Fossil Day with public programs on October 8, 2011.   September 20, 2011  Fee Free National Public Lands Day on September 24  In recognition of National Public Lands Day, Secretary of the Interior Ken Salazar announced free admission to all National Park Service sites, including Glen Canyon National Recreation Area (NRA) and Rainbow Bridge National Monument (NM), on September 24.   August 24, 2011  Park Rangers Recover Body of Missing Woman  On the morning of August 23, 2011 the Glen Canyon National Recreation Area Communications Center received a report of a missing person in Slick Rock Canyon   August 24, 2011  Scoping Notice — Preparation of an Environmental Assessment for Lees Ferry Road Rehabilitation and Paria River Bank Stabilization, Glen Canyon National Recreation Area  The National Park Service (NPS) will be preparing an environmental assessment which will analyze the environmental effects of rehabilitating the Lees Ferry Road   July 29, 2011  One Dead, Two Injured After Boating Accident on Lake Powell  A fifteen year-old Boy Scout from Hurricane, UT was killed in a boating accident on Lake Powell Thursday night.   July 25, 2011  Park Entrance Roads will receive work in August  Road work will take place on August 1 and 2 on Lakeshore Drive and the park’s North Entrance road. Work will begin at 5 a.m. MST on Monday, August 1, and continue through 5 p.m. on Tuesday, August 2.   June 21, 2011  Water Quality at Lake Powell is Everyones Job  Visitors are reminded that it’s everyone’s job to keep Lake Powell clean and safe.   June 15, 2011  Updated Regulations Available for Glen Canyon and Rainbow Bridge  Superintendent Todd Brindle announced today the availability of the 2011 Superintendent’s Compendium for Glen Canyon National Recreation Area and Rainbow Bridge National Monument.   June 09, 2011  Rainbow Bridge National Monument Awarded ‘America’s Best Idea’ Grant  The National Park Foundation announced today that it is proud to award Rainbow Bridge National Monument a grant to support the launch of Providing Opportunities for Underserved Navajo Nation Youth Populations to Participate in Ecological Restoration Activities.   June 06, 2011  Parks Join Forces to Rescue Injured Hiker  National Park Service rangers from Glen Canyon National Recreation Area and Grand Canyon National Park joined forces on Saturday, June 4, to rescue an injured hiker from an unnamed canyon near Halls Crossing on Lake Powell.   May 20, 2011  Glen Canyon Continues to Intercept Mussel-Infested Boats  Staff have already intercepted five vessels seeking to launch on Lake Powell that had adult mussels attached.   May 09, 2011  Glen Canyon Announces Expanded Summer Hours for Launch Ramps  The park’s launch ramps are now operating on summer hours.   April 28, 2011  Search Underway for Missing Massachusetts Man at Lake Powell  National Park Service (NPS) staff at Glen Canyon National Recreation Area are searching for a missing Massachusetts man after his canoe capsized near Bullfrog, Utah at Lake Powell.   April 28, 2011  Body of Apparent Drowning Victim Recovered at Lake Powell  A National Park Service (NPS) spokesperson for Glen Canyon National Recreation Area announced this afternoon that park divers have recovered the body of an apparent drowning victim near the Bullfrog Marina in Utah.   April 12, 2011  Free Entry and Special Activities Highlight National Parks Week  Free entry for National Park Week at Glen Canyon NRA.   April 05, 2011  Correction to Wahweap and Bullfrog Launch Ramp Hours for April  Corrected launch ramp hours for April 2011.   March 31, 2011  Spring 2011 Openings and Hours of Operation Announced  With the advent of warm weather, the National Park Service (NPS) announced today the spring schedule of operation for facilities at Glen Canyon National Recreation Area.   March 29, 2011  Mussel Infested Boat Prevented From Launching at Lake Powell  Adult quagga mussels were found on a boat during a routine inspection on March 24th at Antelope Point Marina. After further inspection, live quagga mussel larvae (veligers) were found in the vessel's engine cooling water.   March 21, 2011  Therizinosaur Returns to Glen Canyon after 93 Million Years  Glen Canyon National Recreation Area and the Bureau of Reclamation, as well as community partners, are hosting the Museum of Northern Arizona’s Therizinosaur: Mystery of the Sickle-Claw Dinosaur exhibit at Carl Hayden Visitor Center in Page, AZ.   March 08, 2011  Fire Destroys Vessels at Wahweap Marina  Firefighters battling a fire on Wednesday evening, March 2, in the Wahweap Marina in Glen Canyon National Recreation Area (NRA) were able to save 40 vessels.   March 08, 2011  Installation and Welcome Ceremony for New Superintendent of Glen Canyon National Recreation Area and Rainbow Bridge National Monument  Glen Canyon National Recreation Area announced today that the Installation and Welcome Ceremony for new superintendent Todd Brindle has been set for Tuesday, March 22nd.   March 03, 2011  Boaters Not Recommended to Use Castle Rock Cut Due to Low Lake Levels  It is not recommended that boaters use the Castle Rock Cut for safety reasons.   February 01, 2011  New Fireboat at Glen Canyon National Recreation Area  With the launch of a new fireboat on Lake Powell, Glen Canyon National Recreation Area has upgraded the capacity for responding to marine fires and wildland fires close to the lakeshore.   January 11, 2011  Glen Canyon will Waive Entrance Fees during Martin Luther King, Jr. Holiday Weekend  Secretary of the Interior Ken Salazar announced free admission to all National Park Service sites, including Glen Canyon National Recreation Area, January 15 - 17, in honor of the Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr. holiday weekend.   January 10, 2011  Todd Brindle named superintendent of Glen Canyon National Recreation Area and Rainbow Bridge National Monument  Todd Brindle, a 33-year veteran of the National Park Service (NPS), has been named superintendent of Glen Canyon National Recreation Area in southern Utah and northern Arizona, NPS Intermountain Region Director John Wessels announced today.   December 23, 2010  Glen Canyon is Recruiting Volunteers for Christmas Bird Count  Glen Canyon’s Audubon Christmas Bird Count will be held on Tuesday, January 4, 2011. March 11, 2010  Schedule of Events for Rainbow Bridge Centennial Announced  Staff at Rainbow Bridge National Monument today announced that the full schedule of events commemorating the 100th anniversary of the monument has been posted to the park’s website.   February 25, 2010  Rainbow Bridge National Monument Announces First Centennial Commemoration Event  On Friday, March 12, Carl Hayden Visitor Center will host the first in a series of events to commemorate the 100th anniversary of the establishment of Rainbow Bridge National Monument.   January 14, 2010  Seventeen New Recycling Trailers Arrive at Glen Canyon  Glen Canyon National Recreation Area and ARAMARK – Lake Powell Resorts and Marinas have teamed up to bring 17 new community recycling trailers to Lake Powell and Glen Canyon National Recreation Area.   January 08, 2010  Volunteers Mark Rare Visitor in Annual Glen Canyon Bird Count  Enthusiastic volunteers participating in the Annual Christmas Bird Count at Glen Canyon National Recreation Area identified 81 different species of birds, including a wayward sea duck and a record-setting number of Canadian geese.   December 30, 2009  Glen Canyon to Host Community Open House at Park Headquarters  Glen Canyon National Recreation Area will host a community open house at National Park Service headquarters on Wednesday, January 13, 2010.   December 22, 2009  Glen Canyon to Host Open House on Zebra Mussel Plan  Glen Canyon National Recreation Area announces a January 13 public meeting to discuss zebra and quagga mussel planning at Lake Powell. November 16, 2009  Partnership Born to Combat Invasive Russian Olive  A new partnership has been formed to combat the spread of Russian olive and other invasive weeds on private and public lands in the Escalante River watershed in southern Utah. October 30, 2009  Nevada Man Found Guilty in Quagga Mussel Case  In the first trial involving Glen Canyon National Recreation Area’s mussel prevention regulations, a federal judge has ordered a Nevada man to pay a $2500 fine for failing to have his boat inspected for mussels before launching on Lake Powell.
